name: Minelayer
description: Have fun with Midori, Minelayer and positional ice (Sensei, Chum). Use Hourglass, Grim and Neural Katana on central servers.

name: Event-Ware v1.0
description:
The replicator/insideman is a deck concept I've revisited after seeing prepaid voice pad. I'm still working out the kinks but its a rather fascinating deck to pilot. The main goal is to set up a powerful rig using replicator and inside man and than brute forcing your way.

The trick is the early game when you need to becareful use the tutors properly. Identifying what card you need with hostage/test run is a big difference between winning and loking..

The prepaid's help with the decks burst economy combined with Sure gamble/dirty laundry as well as making test run/eureka less clunky.

Motivation helps to set up eurekas and allows you to shuffle away cards you don't want with replicator/testrun/hostage if you see something you don't want to draw.

Still a work in progress

name: Snow Fort v1.0
description:
A ton-o'-ice deck focused around an economy based on both ice, and security subcontracts. It's ice take relatively little rez so you can afford to layer them deep.

Sensei and Experiential data help make the towers that much more impregnable.

Testing out project ares. If you can hold them out of your main remote long enough early on you can slam them back to the dark ages. Haven't drawn them yet in testing so its still theory crafting at this point.

name: Fast Draw Noise
description: This Noise deck is all about Wyldside. Cards pour in, and the event-based economy keeps things running (get it?).

name: Maximum Denial
description:
Denial pushed to 11, well as long as Reina's not here. Playing all the tricks to make rezzing really costly.

Rook + Xanadu are amazing, Cortez chip is particularly useful for derezzing then Forged Activation a painful but cheap Ice.

Lots of expose, more often than not, Satellite Uplink is really useful to keep money and crypsis counters from an unnecessary run on remote and at the same time now what's the cost of the ICE on HQ, can enable a free account siphon with Cortez chip the next turn.

Smart players will dump ICEs hosting Rook as soon as possible, but with less Ice in the way and a few Forged Activation Order, this strategy still contribute to stay longer in the early game.

Pretty sure there is some tuning to do, I didn't try Katie yet for exemple, and an earlier Sneakdoor Beta with a second copy can also be devastating with the Shutdowns. Maybe more Same Old Things too but space is scarce.

And by all means, mulligan for a rook, without it early you play a basic crypsis only deck without Gabe economic power to sustain
